info.title: Auvik API
info.description:
To use the Auvik APIs, you’ll need a valid Auvik user and the user’s API key. The user must also have the correct role permissions.

Note: The word tenant as it appears in the API descriptions means one of Auvik’s supported tenant types: multi-client or client.

All date formats are formatted in the format of YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS.sssZ, as describe in ISO 8061

To find out more about Auvik’s APIs, click here.

tags.name: Device
tags.description:
The Auvik Device API allows you to view an inventory of devices and other related information discovered by Auvik.

  • Read Multiple Devices’ Info: Pulls detail about multiple devices discovered on your client’s network.
  • Read a Single Device’s Info: Pulls detail about a specific device discovered on your client’s network.

get.description:
Use the Read Multiple Devices’ Info API to pull the collected information about the various devices Auvik has discovered. You’ll need the client ID for the client you want to fetch devices from. The response includes the devices from all of the children of the requested client that the API has access to.

To find the client ID, run the Read Multiple Tenants API.

Looking at the detail screen on the right, click cURL to see the command that will be used. Click Copy to copy the details of the command to your clipboard. Be sure to edit the following parameters within the command:
  • Within the API URL, us1.my (https://auvikapi.us1.my.auvik.com) should be updated to match the region in which your account resides. To locate the region, log into your Auvik dashboard and look at the URL in your browser’s address bar.
  • user@example.com should be the email address of a user with permissions to view device information.
  • apiKey should be the API key that’s been set for the user.
  • 195798545063742726 should be the client ID whose data you wish to fetch information from.
  • filter[deviceType]=router should be whichever key and value pair you want to filter the result set by. See below for a list of filterable parameters.

Differences from V1 API

  • The V2 API accepts only a single tenant parameter instead of a list of tenants. All children of the provided tenant that the API key has access to will be included in the response. Due to the increased performance of the V2 API, we encourage use of the root tenant ID to fetch all of the device data where desired.
  • The default page size is now 1000. The max page size is 10000. We encourage fewer calls with larger page sizes when bulk fetching data.
  • The vendorName attribute is now called make.
  • The makeModel attribute is now called model, as it only contained the model of the device.
  • The makeModel attribute has beem updated to include both the make and model together.
  • The lastModified and stateKnown attributes are no longer available.
  • The deviceDetail object is no longer available, however the manageStatus attribute is now part of the main set of device attributes.

Other Notes

  • V2 device, network and other entity IDs are the same as the IDs used by the V1 API.
  • V2 device API requests now return endpoint & service devices, just like the device list in the web client.

parameters.name: tenant
parameters.description: Tenant ID to request info from. Child tenants will be included in the response.

parameters.name: filter[networks]
parameters.description: Filter by IDs of the networks a device is on.

parameters.name: filter[makeModel]
parameters.description: Filter by the device’s make and model.

parameters.name: filter[onlineStatus]
parameters.description: Filter by the device’s online status.

parameters.name: filter[manageStatus]
parameters.description: Whether this device is managed by Auvik or not

parameters.name: filter[notSeenSince]
parameters.description: Filter by the last seen online time, returning entities not seen online after the provided value.

parameters.name: page[first]
parameters.description: For paginated responses, the first N elements will be returned. Used in combination with page[after].

parameters.name: page[after]
parameters.description: Cursor after which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[first].

parameters.name: page[last]
parameters.description: For paginated responses, the last N services will be returned. Used in combination with page[before].

parameters.name: page[before]
parameters.description: Cursor before which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[last].

get.summary: Read a Single Device’s Info V2 (beta)
get.description:
Use the Read Single Device’s Info API to pull the collected information about a specific device Auvik has discovered. You’ll need the device ID for the specific device.

To find the device IDs, run the Read Multiple Devices API.

Looking at the detail screen on the right, click cURL to see the command that will be used. Click Copy to copy the details of the command to your clipboard. Be sure to edit the following parameters within the command:
  • Within the API URL, us1.my (https://auvikapi.us1.my.auvik.com) should be updated to match the region in which your account resides. To locate the region, log into your Auvik dashboard and look at the URL in your browser’s address bar.
  • user@example.com should be the email address of a user with permissions to view device information.
  • apiKey should be the API key that’s been set for the user.
  • MTk...2Nw should be the device’s ID.

Differences from V1 API

  • The vendorName attribute is now called make.
  • The makeModel attribute is now called model, as it only contained the model of the device.
  • The makeModel attribute has beem updated to include both the make and model together.
  • The lastModified and stateKnown attributes are no longer available.
  • The deviceDetail object is no longer available, however the manageStatus attribute is now part of the main set of device attributes.

Other Notes

  • V2 device, network and other entity IDs are the same as the IDs used by the V1 API.
  • V2 device API requests now return endpoint & service devices, just like the device list in the web client.

appReadMultiple.title: ASM app response
appReadMultiple.description: Root level object per the json-api spec

type.description: The type of object in the API

id.description: The unique identifier for an ASM app

asmAppResourceObject.description: The template for a resource object representing an ASM app.

risk.description: The risk level of the app

dateAdded.description: The date the app was added

disabled.description: The disabled status of the app

managedByPartner.description: Whether the app is managed by a partner

managed3rdParty.description: Wether the app is managed by a 3rd party

noBusinessOwnerRequired.description: If a business owner is required

businessOwnerPlatformUserId.description: The Platform User ID of the business owner

publisherDescription.example: Microsoft is a multinational technology company that develops, manufactures, licenses, and supports software products

identifiers.description: Strings used to identify the application

asmAppAttributes.description: The type-specific properties of the ASM app object returned

cloudActivityCount.description: The number of times a user has accessed this application online

cloudLoginCount.description: The number of times a user has logged into this application online

desktopActivityCount.description: The number of times a user has accessed this application on the desktop

downloadActivityCount.description: The number of times a user has downloaded a file while using this application online

quickScanCount.description: The number of times a user has accessed this application online, specifically found in browser history

azureSignInCount.description: The number of times a user has signed into this application using Azure

googleSignInCount.description: The number of times a user has signed into this application using Google Workspace

googleSSO.description: The number of times a user has signed into this application using Google SSO

microsoftSSO.description: The number of times a user has signed into this application using Microsoft SSO

asmActivitySources.description: Sources of activity related to this application

count.description: The number of users with activity related to this application

monthlyCount.description: The number of users in the last month with activity related to this application

asmApplicationTotalUsers.description: Totals for users with activity related to this application

accountsDetected.description: Have any accounts been detected logging in to this application?

workAccountLoginsDetected.description: Have any work accounts been detected logging in to this application?

personalAccountLoginsDetected.description: Have any personal accounts been detected logging in to this application?

userCountWithWorkAccountLogin.description: Count of users that have logged in to this application with a work account
userCountWithWorkAccountLogin.x-label: Users with Work Account Logins Detected

userCountWithPersonalAccountLogin.description: Count of users that have logged in to this application with a personal account
userCountWithPersonalAccountLogin.x-label: Users with Personal Account Logins Detected

dateAdded.description: The data the breach was added

description.example:
GitHub discovered the breach on April 12, when the attacker accessed GitHub's npm production infrastructure, and disclosed the breach three days later.

Along with Heroku and Travis CI, GitHub has revoked all OAuth tokens to block further access, while still advising affected organizations to keep monitoring for suspicious activity.

tenant.description: Tenant ID to request info from. Child tenants will be included in the response.

tenants.name: tenants
tenants.description: Comma delimited list of tenant IDs to request info from.

includeDeviceDetailParam.name: include
includeDeviceDetailParam.description: Use to include the full resource objects of the list device relationships.

deviceDetailFieldsParam.name: fields[deviceDetail]
deviceDetailFieldsParam.description: Use to limit the attributes that will be returned in the included detail object to only what is specified by this query parameter. Requires include=deviceDetail

networkScanStatusFilterParam.name: filter[scanStatus]
networkScanStatusFilterParam.description: Filter by the network’s scan status.

networkDevicesFilterParam.name: filter[devices]
networkDevicesFilterParam.description: Filter by IDs of devices on this network. Filter by multiple values by providing a comma delimited list.

parentDeviceIdFilterParam.name: filter[parentDevice]
parentDeviceIdFilterParam.description: Filter by the entity's parent device ID.

onlineStatusFilterParam.name: filter[onlineStatus]
onlineStatusFilterParam.description: Filter by the device’s online status.

modifiedAfterFilterParam.name: filter[modifiedAfter]
modifiedAfterFilterParam.description: Filter by date and time, only returning entities modified after provided value.

notSeenSinceFilterParam.name: filter[notSeenSince]
notSeenSinceFilterParam.description: Filter by the last seen online time, returning entities not seen online after the provided value.

stateKnownFilterParam.name: filter[stateKnown]
stateKnownFilterParam.description: Filter by devices with recently updated data, for more consistent results.

usageFromDateFilterParam.name: filter[fromDate]
usageFromDateFilterParam.description: Date from which you want to query

usageThruDateFilterParam.name: filter[thruDate]
usageThruDateFilterParam.description: Date to which you want to query

includeAsmClientDetailParam.name: include
includeAsmClientDetailParam.description: Use to include extended details of the client.

includeAsmApplicationDetailParam.name: include
includeAsmApplicationDetailParam.description: Use to include extended details of the application or of its related objects.

includeAsmSecurityLogDetailParam.name: include
includeAsmSecurityLogDetailParam.description: Use to include extended details of the security log or of its related objects.

pageFirstParam.name: page[first]
pageFirstParam.description: For paginated responses, the first N elements will be returned. Used in combination with page[after].

pageAfterParam.name: page[after]
pageAfterParam.description: Cursor after which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[first].

pageLastParam.name: page[last]
pageLastParam.description: For paginated responses, the last N services will be returned. Used in combination with page[before].

pageBeforeParam.name: page[before]
pageBeforeParam.description: Cursor before which elements will be returned as a page. The page size is provided by page[last].

statFilterFromTimeParam.name: filter[fromTime]
statFilterFromTimeParam.description: Timestamp from which you want to query

statFilterThruTimeParam.name: filter[thruTime]
statFilterThruTimeParam.description: Timestamp to which you want to query (defaults to current time)

ApiKey.description: Username and apiKey as the password
